sense.name: stretch out or over completely
sense.examples: They spread-eagled him across the floor. His residences spread-eagled the entire county. I ended up on my back, spread-eagled and concussed. The guy in the seat next to me was spread-eagled over two seats. The last student on the roof screamed and dove spread-eagled into the night sky. Chassi, spread-eagled in between them, drew on the table. The Goan was spread-eagled on the ground.

sense.name: stand with arms and legs stretched out
sense.examples: The young woman was standing spread-eagled against the wall. The two men were spread-eagled on just such a stone wall Pangle stood, arms and legs spread-eagled. Annie stood spread-eagle on her skates.

sense.name: defeat disastrously
sense.examples: The fighter managed to spread-eagle his opponent
